symptoms.name: Fever
symptoms.pattern: Periodic (e.g., every two days in one case), can persist even with antibiotic treatment

symptoms.name: Polymorphic cutaneous rash
symptoms.severity: Variable, can range from maculopapular to nodular, petechial, polymorphous, or necrotic

symptoms.name: Migratory arthropathy
symptoms.severity: Variable, can range from arthralgia to arthritis
symptoms.pattern: Migratory, affecting larger joints like knees and ankles, more evident during febrile periods

vital_signs.temperature: Elevated (38.5°C in one case), can persist despite treatment
vital_signs.blood_pressure: Can be normal (106/65 mmHg in one case), or slightly elevated (112/84 mmHg in one case)

physical_findings: Limited range of motion in affected joints
Local heat and swelling in affected joints

lab_values.blood_cultures: Positive for Neisseria meningitidis (often requires multiple samples due to intermittent bacteremia)
lab_values.CRP: Elevated (205 mg/L in one case, 140 mg/L in another case)
lab_values.other_tests: Serology for HIV, hepatitis B and C, syphilis, rheumatoid factor, ANF, anti-ds DNA, anti Ro, anti-Sm, C3, and C4 (often negative in chronic meningococcemia)

imaging_findings.abdominal_ultrasound: Enlarged liver and possible hemangioma in one case

required: Chronic meningococcal bacteremia (lasting at least one week)
Absence of meningeal signs or symptoms
Positive blood cultures for Neisseria meningitidis (may require multiple samples)
